titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Renacker and John D. Renacker, Affidavit
CWG4630

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwelath
vs } on forfeited recognizances
Wm Renacker & John D Renacker
Wm Renacker & John D Renacker state that their Brother George Renacker was by the Grand Two Justices of the Peace for Grant County

Held to Bail in the sum of $500 ^$250. Each^ and that they became his Bail & went upon his Bond for his appearance at Court to answer the charge They say that he failed to appear according to the conditions of his Bonds & the same was forfeited & Judgment has been rendered therein by the Grant Circuit Court They further note that the Deft George Renacker is hopelessly insolvent and that they are in no way indemnified for anything they may pos ^pay as^ his his surety in said Bond & all that they do pay will be a clear loss to them They further say that at a subsequent term of the court to the ^one^ to which he was recognized they delivered him to the court & he was tried for the offence & finded $50.00
Sworn to before me by Wm Renacker this 2nd day of February 1864
W. T. Simmons Notary Public for Grant County
